text:
Everything You Need to Know About Volkswagen's Emissions Scandal Written by: Laurie Kulikowski 09/24/15 - 2:30 PM EDT 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Social media is calling the Volkswagen emissions scandal #VWGate, a reference to Watergate. 
In case you have been living under a rock, Volkswagen's deliberate cheating on U.S. emissions tests has been the biggest news of the week -- right up there with Pope Francis' visit to the U.S. 
Despite blanket coverage by news media with updates on the scandal, lots of people are still asking questions on Google and social media. More Headlines 12 'A+' Rated Stocks With Great Growth Potential and High Return on Invested Capital 
And we're going to answer them for you. We looked at some of the most popular questions about VW on Google and social media to bring you the answers. 
To become well versed in Volkswagen, read to the end to find out all about the scandal. And when you're done, be sure to check out car scandals that were bigger than Volkswagen's. 
1. So what exactly happened at Volkswagen? 
Volkswagen is facing a major scandal involving using software to cheat on emission tests on its diesel cars in the U.S. The company admitted that it installed specific software designed to fool emissions tests, making it look like the cars involved (the tally is actually 11 million cars worldwide) were more fuel efficient than they actually were. 
The company said that it set aside approximately $7 billion to handle potential fines, recalls and vehicle buybacks, but reports are saying the EPA could hammer the company with fines as high as $18 billion. 1
